column4: is there any such thing as a "files and settings transfer wizard" for moving from 9.10 to 10.04
e.g. is it safe to just tarball my home dir and then unpack it?
that should be fine
will that work? will that restore my gnome panels and such?
what if versions are different?
all your settings for your desktop are stored under your home directory
will that also restore my panel positions and icons and stuff
ok
the version thing is something that has always annoyed me though...  someone needs to come up with a good migration solution for that someday
if it won't be exactly the same, it should hopefully at least be really close so it won't take too terribly long to get it exactly the way you want
10.04 is really nice too btw
k
i just need it to be faster mostly, i probably won't be using GNOME
probably going with openbox
though i do wish i could figure out how to better configure openbox
old computer?
umm, not as much as what i'm doing with it
audio video sucks down the processor time
that should still be fast enough with gnome
yeah actually moving to fluxbox didn't make much of a difference, still ended up with the same issue
although i think i know how to solve it temporarily, but it's a hack and a PITA
